page.title: 10ANTIQUE SHIPPER LOWER HEATH
page.content: George Benbow{buys old furniture}which goes to{America and Canada}to be sold because those countries do not have{antique furniture}of their own.The old furniture is shipped over to America and Canada in {containers.}In America and Canada the people use the furniture differently: {lamp shades}are used for hanging baskets,{glass cabinets}are used for the ends of bars to show off their best glasses,{wardrobes}are used for hall cabinets and{old washing machines are used for putting plants in.Mr Benbow sells a lot of mirrors because in America they have them every where. Mr Benbow makes new furniture out of old wood and sells it in a furniture shop in Market Drayton.Mr Benbow buys the furniture at{auction sales}and from other dealers all over the Midlands and in Wales.
